Key Match Events: Jordi Fernandez, who was a Nuggets assistant coach for six years, shouts out instructions during the Nets’ 124-105 loss to the Nuggets on Jan. 10, 2025.
Ben Simmons, who scored 10 points and had seven assists, and Day’Ron Sharpe (seven points, five rebounds) returned to the court Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: Jordi Fernandez reflected on his time with the Nuggets and how it prepared him for his current role with the Nets.
Michael Malone praised Fernandez's hunger for learning and his ability to relate to players, noting that it was only a matter of time before he got a head coaching opportunity.
Fernandez emphasized the importance of establishing a culture and identity before achieving wins.
Others: Cam Johnson (right ankle sprain) and D’Angelo Russell (right shin contusion) were out and are considered day-to-day.
Trendon Watford (left hamstring strain) most likely won’t play until the Nets return home.
